pkgmetadata.longdescription: Electron is a cross platform application development framework based on web technologies based on Chromium

use.flag: Enable JavaScript type-checking for Chrome's web technology-based UI. Requires Java.
Use memory allocator from libc instead of Chromium's partition allocator
Split build into more shared libraries to speed up linking. Mostly intended for debugging and development, NOT RECOMMENDED for general use.
Build Ozone only with headless backend, NOT RECOMMENDED for general use.
Build with link time optimization enabled
Use bundled libc++ instead of libstdc++ for building.
Disable optimized assembly code that is not PIC friendly
Enable proprietary codecs like H.264, MP3
Enable support for remote desktop and screen cast using media-video/pipewire
Use system ffmpeg instead of the bundled one
Use system harfbuzz instead of the bundled one.
Use system icu instead of the bundled one
Use system libpng instead of the bundled one.
